meanings.definition: A member of the working class
meanings.sent1: The prole worked hard in the factory every day.
meanings.sent2: The city was full of proles going to their jobs.
meanings.sent3: The prole accidentally dropped his lunchbox in the machine!
meanings.sent4: In the sea of suits, she felt like a lone prole.
meanings.sent5: The prole's calloused hands told the story of his labor.

meanings.definition: A person lacking in education or refinement
meanings.sent1: The prole struggled to read the complex instructions.
meanings.sent2: She felt out of place at the fancy gala, surrounded by proles.
meanings.sent3: The prole mistook the salad fork for a spoon at the dinner party.
meanings.sent4: Her manners were so refined, she stood out among the proles.
meanings.sent5: The prole's speech was filled with slang and grammatical errors.

meanings.sent1: The cat will prole a litter of kittens soon.
meanings.sent2: The farm animals prole new life each spring.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to prole flowers overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity seemed to prole endless ideas.
meanings.sent5: The tree proled fruit that was ripe and juicy.
